title: Memories of items and their contexts are encoded by separate groups of human brain cells
summary:
Nature, Published online: 14 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00016-x

Human memory often needs to link specific items to the situation in which they feature. Brain recordings reveal that two distinct groups of neurons respon…
body: Nature, Published online: 14 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00016-x Human memory often needs to link specific items to the situation in which they feature. Brain recordings reveal that two distinct groups of neurons respond to stimuli and contextual information. These groups then cooperate to form flexible memories, rather than individual neurons encoding both signal types.
